name: Introduction to Public Health
description: Learn how public health improves population wellbeing through policy and prevention.

name: Nutrition and Metabolism
description: Understand how diet and metabolism affect human health and disease.

name: Microbiology and Immunology
description: Study microorganisms and immune system functions.

name: Pharmacology Essentials
description: Introduction to drug actions, mechanisms, and therapeutic uses.

name: Epidemiology Fundamentals
description: Learn how to study, analyze, and interpret health data in populations.

name: Mental Health and Wellbeing
description: Understand mental disorders and strategies for promoting psychological health.

name: Pathophysiology
description: Study the physiological processes associated with disease.

name: Global Health Issues
description: Examine global health systems and challenges like pandemics and inequities.

name: Genetics in Medicine
description: Explore how genetics and genomics influence medical diagnosis and treatment.

name: Clinical Research Design
description: Learn the principles of clinical trials and evidence-based practice.

name: Healthcare Management
description: Discover how to manage hospitals, policies, and healthcare systems efficiently.

name: First Aid and Emergency Care
description: Practical guide to handling medical emergencies and first aid.

name: Medical Ethics
description: Study ethical issues in clinical practice, research, and healthcare.

name: Evidence-Based Medicine
description: Learn how to apply clinical research findings to patient care.
